conformal mappings, open mapping theorem

Prove that the punctured disc {z∈C∣0<∣z∣<1}\set{z \in \C \mid 0 < \abs{z} < 1}{z∈C∣0<∣z∣<1} and the annulus given by {z∈C∣1<∣z∣<2}\set{z \in \C \mid 1 < \abs{z} < 2}{z∈C∣1<∣z∣<2} are not conformally equivalent.
Solution.

Suppose otherwise, and let f ⁣:D∖{0}→A\func{f}{\D \setminus \set{0}}{A}f:D∖{0}→A be conformal, where AAA is the annulus in the question. In particular, fff is bounded and holomorphic near 000, so it extends to a holomorphic function g ⁣:D→C\func{g}{\D}{\C}g:D→C.

We claim that ggg is injective. Suppose otherwise, so that w=g(0)=g(z)w = g\p{0} = g\p{z}w=g(0)=g(z) for some z∈D∖{0}z \in \D \setminus \set{0}z∈D∖{0}. Let UUU be an open ball around 000 and VVV an open ball around zzz such that U∩V=∅U \cap V = \emptysetU∩V=∅ and U,V⊆DU, V \subseteq \DU,V⊆D. By the open mapping theorem, g(U)g\p{U}g(U) and g(V)g\p{V}g(V) are open. By assumption, w∈g(U)∩g(V)w \in g\p{U} \cap g\p{V}w∈g(U)∩g(V), so their intersection is also open and non-empty. In particular, (g(U)∩g(V))∖{w}\p{g\p{U} \cap g\p{V}} \setminus \set{w}(g(U)∩g(V))∖{w} is non-empty, so there exist z1∈U∖{0}z_1 \in U \setminus \set{0}z1​∈U∖{0} and z2∈V∖{z}z_2 \in V \setminus \set{z}z2​∈V∖{z} such that g(z1)=g(z2)g\p{z_1} = g\p{z_2}g(z1​)=g(z2​). By construction of UUU and VVV, z1≠z2z_1 \neq z_2z1​=z2​ and z1,z2∈D∖{0}z_1, z_2 \in \D \setminus \set{0}z1​,z2​∈D∖{0}, but this implies that f(z1)=f(z2)f\p{z_1} = f\p{z_2}f(z1​)=f(z2​), contradicting injectivity of fff. Thus, ggg must have been injective to begin with.

By continuity, g(0)∈A‾g\p{0} \in \cl{A}g(0)∈A, but by injectivity, g(0)∉Ag\p{0} \notin Ag(0)∈/A, so g(0)g\p{0}g(0) is a boundary point of AAA. Now let UUU be an open neighborhood of 000 in D\DD, so that g(U)g\p{U}g(U) is an open neighborhood of g(0)g\p{0}g(0) by the open mapping theorem. g(0)g\p{0}g(0) is a boundary point of AAA, so g(U)∩(A‾)c≠∅g\p{U} \cap \p{\cl{A}}^\comp \neq \emptysetg(U)∩(A)c=∅, but by continuity, g(U)⊆A‾g\p{U} \subseteq \cl{A}g(U)⊆A, a contradiction. Thus, no such ggg could have existed to begin with, so there is no conformal mapping from D∖{0}\D \setminus \set{0}D∖{0} to AAA, which completes the proof.
